1.title: First Sunday of Advent - The Hope Candle
1.prayer: Rorate caeli desuper, et nubes pluant iustum: aperiatur terra, et germinet Salvatorem.
1.prayerTranslation: Drop down dew, ye heavens, from above, and let the clouds rain the just: let the earth be opened and bud forth a Saviour.
1.scripture: Isaiah 64:1 - Oh, that you would rend the heavens and come down, that the mountains would tremble before you!
1.reflection: As we light our first candle, we remember the hope of Israel for the coming Messiah. This hope sustains us as we await Christ's coming in our own hearts.
1.globalWonder: üåü The hope of Christ's coming unites believers across all nations and cultures

2.title: December 1st - The Promise of a Savior
2.prayer: Excita, quaesumus, Domine, potentiam tuam, et veni: ut ab imminentibus peccatorum nostrorum periculis, te mereamur protegente eripi, te liberante salvari.
2.prayerTranslation: Stir up your power, O Lord, and come: that by your protection we may be rescued from the threatening dangers of our sins and saved by your deliverance.
2.scripture: Isaiah 40:3-5 - A voice of one calling: 'Prepare the way for the LORD in the wilderness; make straight in the desert a highway for our God.'
2.reflection: John the Baptist's call to prepare the way reminds us to clear the obstacles in our own hearts that prevent Christ from dwelling fully within us.
2.globalWonder: üïäÔ∏è Christians worldwide prepare their hearts during Advent, creating a global spiritual anticipation

3.title: December 2nd - The Annunciation
3.prayer: Ave Maria, gratia plena, Dominus tecum: benedicta tu in mulieribus, et benedictus fructus ventris tui, Iesus.
3.prayerTranslation: Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee: blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus.
3.scripture: Luke 1:26-38 - The angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee called Nazareth, to a virgin betrothed to a man named Joseph.
3.reflection: Mary's 'yes' to God changed history. Her humble acceptance teaches us that God's plans often come in unexpected ways.
3.globalWonder: üëº The angel's message to Mary echoes through time, reminding all of God's loving plan for humanity

4.title: December 3rd - The Visitation
4.prayer: Magnificat anima mea Dominum, et exsultavit spiritus meus in Deo salutari meo.
4.prayerTranslation: My soul magnifies the Lord, and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior.
4.scripture: Luke 1:39-45 - Mary set out and traveled to the hill country in haste to a town of Judah, where she entered the house of Zechariah.
4.reflection: Mary's visit to Elizabeth shows us the importance of Christian community and sharing our spiritual joys with one another.
4.globalWonder: ü§ù The bond between Mary and Elizabeth reflects the unity of all believers in Christ

5.title: December 4th - The Magnificat
5.prayer: Fecit potentiam in brachio suo; dispersit superbos mente cordis sui.
5.prayerTranslation: He has shown might with his arm; he has scattered the proud in the conceit of their heart.
5.scripture: Luke 1:46-55 - And Mary said: 'My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord; my spirit rejoices in God my savior.'
5.reflection: Mary's song reminds us that God exalts the humble and fills the hungry with good things. His mercy extends to all generations.
5.globalWonder: üéµ The Magnificat is sung daily in churches worldwide, uniting Christians in praise

6.title: December 5th - John the Baptist's Birth
6.prayer: Tu, puer, propheta Altissimi vocaberis: praeibis enim ante faciem Domini parare vias eius.
6.prayerTranslation: And you, child, will be called prophet of the Most High, for you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways.
6.scripture: Luke 1:57-66 - When the time arrived for Elizabeth to have her child she gave birth to a son.
6.reflection: John's birth to elderly parents reminds us that nothing is impossible with God. He prepares the way for Christ in unexpected circumstances.
6.globalWonder: üë∂ The miracle of John's birth points to God's power to bring life where there seems to be none

7.title: December 6th - St. Nicholas Day
7.prayer: Deus, qui beatum Nicolaum Pontificem innumeris decorasti miraculis: tribue, quaesumus; ut eius meritis et precibus a gehemnalibus incendii liberemur.
7.prayerTranslation: O God, who adorned the Blessed Bishop Nicholas with countless miracles: grant, we beseech you, that by his merits and prayers we may be delivered from the fires of hell.
7.scripture: Matthew 6:19-21 - Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and decay destroy, and thieves break in and steal.
7.reflection: St. Nicholas embodied Christian charity. His generosity reminds us that true wealth lies in what we give, not what we possess.
7.globalWonder: üéÅ The spirit of giving inspired by St. Nicholas spans continents and cultures

8.title: Second Sunday of Advent - The Peace Candle
8.prayer: Deus, qui conspicis quia ex nostra pravitati affligimur: concede propitius; ut ex adventu Unigeniti tui consolationem recipiamus.
8.prayerTranslation: O God, who see how we are afflicted by our own perversity: mercifully grant that we may be comforted by the advent of your Only Begotten Son.
8.scripture: Isaiah 11:1-10 - But a shoot shall sprout from the stump of Jesse, and from his roots a bud shall blossom.
8.reflection: The peace Christ brings isn't the absence of conflict, but the presence of justice, righteousness, and harmony with God.
8.globalWonder: üïäÔ∏è Christ's peace transcends all human divisions, offering reconciliation to the whole world

9.title: December 8th - Immaculate Conception
9.prayer: Deus, qui per immaculatam Virginis Conceptionem dignum Filio tuo habitaculum praeparasti: quaesumus; ut qui ex morte eiusdem Filii tui praevista eam ab omni labe praeservasti.
9.prayerTranslation: O God, who by the Immaculate Conception of the Virgin did prepare a worthy dwelling place for your Son: we beseech you that, as by the foreseen death of your Son, you did preserve her from all stain.
9.scripture: Luke 1:28 - And coming to her, he said, 'Hail, favored one! The Lord is with you.'
9.reflection: Mary's preservation from original sin highlights God's power to create vessels of extraordinary grace for his divine purposes.
9.globalWonder: üåπ Mary's unique role in salvation history is celebrated by Christians worldwide

10.title: December 9th - The Jesse Tree
10.prayer: Ecce radix Iesse, qui stat in signum populorum, ipsum gentes deprecabuntur.
10.prayerTranslation: Behold the root of Jesse, who stands as an ensign of the people, him the Gentiles shall beseech.
10.scripture: Isaiah 11:10 - On that day, the root of Jesse, set up as a signal for the nations, the Gentiles shall seek out.
10.reflection: The Jesse Tree traces salvation history, reminding us that Christ's coming was prepared through generations of faithful people.
10.globalWonder: üå≥ The lineage of Christ connects all believers as part of God's family tree

11.title: December 10th - The O Antiphons Begin
11.prayer: O Sapientia, quae ex ore Altissimi prodiisti, attingens a fine usque ad finem, fortiter suaviterque disponens omnia: veni ad docendum nos viam prudentiae.
11.prayerTranslation: O Wisdom, who came from the mouth of the Most High, reaching from end to end and ordering all things mightily and sweetly: come, and teach us the way of prudence.
11.scripture: Proverbs 8:22-31 - The LORD possessed me, the beginning of his ways, the forerunner of his prodigies of long ago.
11.reflection: The O Antiphons express the Church's ancient longing for the Messiah, using rich titles that reveal different aspects of Christ.
11.globalWonder: üé∂ The O Antiphons have been sung for centuries, connecting modern Christians with ancient tradition

12.title: December 11th - O Adonai
12.prayer: O Adonai, et Dux domus Israel, qui Moysi in igne flammae rubi apparuisti, et ei in Sina legem dedisti: veni ad redimendum nos in brachio extento.
12.prayerTranslation: O Lord and Ruler of the house of Israel, who appeared to Moses in the fire of the burning bush and gave him the law on Sinai: come, and redeem us with an outstretched arm.
12.scripture: Exodus 3:2-6 - There an angel of the LORD appeared to him in fire flaming out of a bush.
12.reflection: Christ is the new Moses who leads us from slavery to sin into the freedom of God's children.
12.globalWonder: üî• The God who appeared in the burning bush comes to dwell among us in the flesh

13.title: December 12th - Our Lady of Guadalupe
13.prayer: Deus, qui sub beatissimae Virginis Mariae singulari praesidio constituisti: praesta, quaesumus; ut, cuius hodie memoriam agimus, eius muniamur auxilio ad pacem.
13.prayerTranslation: O God, who has placed us under the special protection of the most Blessed Virgin Mary: grant, we beseech you, that we may be defended by her help and attain peace.
13.scripture: Revelation 12:1 - A great sign appeared in the sky, a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet.
13.reflection: Our Lady of Guadalupe shows Mary's maternal care for all peoples, especially the poor and marginalized.
13.globalWonder: üåπ Mary appears as a mother to all nations, speaking every language and embracing every culture

14.title: December 13th - O Radix Jesse
14.prayer: O Radix Iesse, qui stas in signum populorum, super quem continebunt reges os suum, quem Gentes deprecabuntur: veni ad liberandum nos, iam noli tardare.
14.prayerTranslation: O Root of Jesse, who stands as a sign for the peoples, before whom kings shall shut their mouths, whom the nations shall seek: come to deliver us, and do not delay.
14.scripture: Isaiah 11:10 - On that day, the root of Jesse, set up as a signal for the nations, the Gentiles shall seek out.
14.reflection: From the seemingly dead stump of Jesse's line comes the flourishing shoot of our salvation.
14.globalWonder: üå± From one small nation comes salvation for all humanity

15.title: Third Sunday of Advent - The Joy Candle
15.prayer: Gaudete in Domino semper: iterum dico, gaudete. Modestia vestra nota sit omnibus hominibus: Dominus prope est.
15.prayerTranslation: Rejoice in the Lord always; again I say, rejoice. Let your moderation be known to all men: The Lord is near.
15.scripture: Philippians 4:4-7 - Rejoice in the Lord always. I shall say it again: rejoice!
15.reflection: Gaudete Sunday reminds us that Christian joy isn't dependent on circumstances but on the nearness of our Savior.
15.globalWonder: üòä The joy of anticipation unites Christians across the globe as Christmas approaches

16.title: December 15th - O Clavis David
16.prayer: O Clavis David, et sceptrum domus Israel: qui aperis, et nemo claudit; claudis, et nemo aperit: veni, et educ vinctum de domo carceris, sedentem in tenebris, et umbra mortis.
16.prayerTranslation: O Key of David, and scepter of the house of Israel: who opens and no one shuts, who shuts and no one opens: come, and lead the captive from prison, sitting in darkness and in the shadow of death.
16.scripture: Isaiah 22:22 - I will place the key of the House of David on his shoulder; what he opens, no one will shut, what he shuts, no one will open.
16.reflection: Christ holds the key to our liberation from sin and death, opening for us the gates of eternal life.
16.globalWonder: üîë The keys of the Kingdom open salvation to people of every nation and tongue

17.title: December 16th - O Oriens
17.prayer: O Oriens, splendor lucis aeternae, et sol iustitiae: veni, et illumina sedentes in tenebris, et umbra mortis.
17.prayerTranslation: O Dayspring, splendor of light eternal and sun of justice: come, and enlighten those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death.
17.scripture: Luke 1:78-79 - Because of the tender mercy of our God by which the daybreak from on high will visit us to shine on those who sit in darkness and death's shadow.
17.reflection: Christ is the true light that darkness cannot overcome, dawning with healing in his wings.
17.globalWonder: ‚òÄÔ∏è The light of Christ dawns upon every nation, dispelling the darkness of sin

18.title: December 17th - O Rex Gentium
18.prayer: O Rex Gentium, et desideratus earum, lapisque angularis, qui facis utraque unum: veni, et salva hominem, quem de limo formasti.
18.prayerTranslation: O King of the Nations, and their desired one, and the cornerstone that makes both one: come, and save man, whom you formed from the slime.
18.scripture: Ephesians 2:14-20 - For he is our peace, he who made both one and broke down the dividing wall of enmity, through his flesh.
18.reflection: Christ is the cornerstone that unites Jew and Gentile, making us one new people in himself.
18.globalWonder: üëë Christ's kingship transcends all earthly powers, uniting people from every tribe and nation

19.title: December 18th - O Emmanuel
19.prayer: O Emmanuel, Rex et legifer noster, exspectatio Gentium, et Salvator earum: veni ad salvandum nos, Domine, Deus noster.
19.prayerTranslation: O Emmanuel, our King and Lawgiver, the Expected of the nations and their Saviour: come to save us, O Lord our God.
19.scripture: Isaiah 7:14 - Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign; the young woman, pregnant and about to bear a son, shall name him Emmanuel.
19.reflection: God is with us - this is the heart of the Christmas mystery. The infinite becomes infant, the eternal enters time.
19.globalWonder: üë∂ The miracle of Emmanuel - God with us - is celebrated by Christians in every corner of the earth

20.title: December 19th - The Genealogy of Jesus
20.prayer: Liber generationis Iesu Christi, filii David, filii Abraham.
20.prayerTranslation: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
20.scripture: Matthew 1:1-17 - The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
20.reflection: Jesus' genealogy includes saints and sinners, Jews and Gentiles, reminding us that salvation is for all.
20.globalWonder: üìú The family tree of Jesus embraces all humanity in God's saving plan

21.title: December 20th - Joseph's Dream
21.prayer: Angelus Domini apparuit in somnis Ioseph, dicens: Ioseph, fili David, noli timere accipere Mariam coniugem tuam: quod enim in ea natum est, de Spiritu Sancto est.
21.prayerTranslation: The angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, 'Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary your wife into your home.'
21.scripture: Matthew 1:18-25 - This is how the birth of Jesus Christ came about.
21.reflection: Joseph's faithful obedience, despite his confusion, shows us how to trust God's mysterious plans.
21.globalWonder: üí≠ God speaks to the humble heart, guiding ordinary people to participate in extraordinary plans

22.title: Fourth Sunday of Advent - The Love Candle
22.prayer: Ecce ancilla Domini: fiat mihi secundum verbum tuum.
22.prayerTranslation: Behold the handmaid of the Lord: be it done unto me according to thy word.
22.scripture: Luke 1:26-38 - Mary said, 'Behold, I am the handmaid of the Lord. May it be done to me according to your word.'
22.reflection: Mary's loving surrender to God's will enables the Incarnation. Her 'yes' opens the way for our salvation.
22.globalWonder: ‚ù§Ô∏è Mary's loving obedience brings the Savior to all humanity

23.title: December 23rd - The Visitation Revisited
23.prayer: Et unde hoc mihi ut veniat mater Domini mei ad me?
23.prayerTranslation: And how does this happen to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
23.scripture: Luke 1:39-45 - When Elizabeth heard Mary's greeting, the infant leaped in her womb.
23.reflection: Even in the womb, John recognizes Jesus and leaps for joy. The presence of Christ brings joy to all who encounter him.
23.globalWonder: üë∂ The unborn John bears witness to the presence of the unborn Savior

24.title: Christmas Eve - The Night of Wonder
24.prayer: Hodie scietis quia veniet Dominus, et mane videbitis gloriam eius.
24.prayerTranslation: Today you will know that the Lord is coming, and in the morning you will see his glory.
24.scripture: Luke 2:1-7 - In those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that the whole world should be enrolled.
24.reflection: In the stillness of this holy night, heaven touches earth, and the Word becomes flesh to dwell among us.
24.globalWonder: üåü Tonight, Christians around the world keep vigil, awaiting the celebration of our Savior's birth
